headline: PLEASE DO NOT WORK HERE !
pros: Not much in this section.  Most of the time got work done within hours specified so didn't have to stay late.  Coworkers were dedicated and hard working.  Willing to go that extra step.
cons: Where do I begin.  Salary was very low for new york city.  It was nearly impossible to move up beyond senior level unless you were friends with upper management.  Benefits were average at best .  Technology was sub par in operations area.  Company moved jobs from manhattan to brooklyn.  Don't expect to make big money here.

headline: Solid training and quality of life for LI based job
pros: Good training program for people just entering the financial services field. Sponsor for securities licenses and examinations. Shift type work for most entry and mid level equates to high quality of life and little "take home stress". Atmosphere was supportive, not competitive.
cons: LI based operation leads to less compensation and fewer opportunities to move up. Always felt there was a chance they could move this operation to a different part of the country due to high cost of doing business on Long Island.
